intro: Melilotus plicatus, commonly known as the zigzag melilot, is a herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which is characterized by its leguminous properties and nitrogen-fixing capabilities. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30–60 cm, featuring trifoliate leaves and yellow flowers arranged in racemes. Its seeds are enclosed in pods and are often used in traditional medicine for their mild sedative effects. Melilotus plicatus thrives in disturbed soils and is often found in meadows and along roadsides.
